means: 滑动，滑行( slide的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He needs them to stop the country sliding into chaos.
sentence.Network_cn: 他需要他们来防止这个国家陷入混乱。

sentence.Network_en: The company had to do something to reverse its sliding fortunes.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个公司不得不采取一些措施扭转下滑的运势。

sentence.Network_en: The company is sliding even deeper into the red.
sentence.Network_cn: 公司的亏损状况进一步恶化。

entry.def: When something slides somewhere or when you slide it there, it moves there smoothly over or against something.

example.ex: I slid the wallet into his pocket...
example.tran: 我把钱包麻利地塞进了他的口袋。

entry.tran: 麻利而无声地移动;悄悄地溜到
entry.def: If you slide somewhere, you move there smoothly and quietly.

example.ex: He slid into the driver's seat...
example.tran: 他麻利地坐进驾驶员的座位。

example.ex: 'Nice meeting you, Zoe,' I said and slid off.
example.tran: “很高兴见到你，佐薇，”说完我便溜走了。

entry.tran: 不自觉地陷入(某种情绪、态度或情境)
entry.def: To slide into a particular mood, attitude, or situation means to gradually start to have that mood, attitude, or situation often without intending to.

example.ex: She had slid into a depression...
He needs them to stop the country sliding into chaos.
example.tran: 他需要他们来防止这个国家陷入混乱。

entry.def: If currencies or prices slide, they gradually become worse or lower in value.

example.ex: The US dollar continued to slide...
The upset sent share prices sliding to their lowest level for almost 18 months...
example.tran: 这种不安情绪使股票价格跌落到几乎 18 个月以来的最低水平。

entry.def: A slide is a small piece of photographic film which you project onto a screen so that you can see the picture.
A slide is a piece of glass on which you put something that you want to examine through a microscope.
A slide is a piece of playground equipment that has a steep slope for children to go down for fun.

entry.tran: 放任…自流;任…恶化而不予处理
entry.def: If you let something slide, you allow it to get into a worse state or condition by not attending to it.

example.ex: The company had let environmental standards slide.
example.tran: 这家公司听凭环境标准的不断下降。

auth_sentence.res_content: He could be sliding or injecting something into him.

auth_sentence.res_content: My rubber-sandaled feet went sliding across the marble floor.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: My rubber-sandaled feet went sliding across the marble floor.

Sentence.sentence: Although many of Hills dale's students came from wealthy households, by the late 1990 average test scores were sliding and it had earned the unaffectionate nickname (绰号) "Hills jail.
